docs.snippet: A battered and blood-streaked survivor of a bear attack said in a video he shot on his way to the hospital that the animal attacked him twice as he played dead before hiking 3 miles to his truck to seek help.

headline.print_headline: Blood-Streaked Survivor Recounts Bear Attack on Facebook
headline.main: Blood-Streaked Survivor Recounts Bear Attack on Facebook

docs.snippet: The mayor of a small central Pennsylvania town is being asked to resign over racist posts on his Facebook page, including two depicting apes with captions referring to President Barack Obama and his family, and one referring to lynching.

headline.print_headline: Pennsylvania Mayor Asked to Resign for Racist Facebook Posts
headline.main: Pennsylvania Mayor Asked to Resign for Racist Facebook Posts

docs.snippet: Facebook said it would appeal against an order by a German privacy regulator on Tuesday to stop collecting and storing data of German users of its messaging app WhatsApp and to delete all data that has already been forwarded to it.

headline.print_headline: Facebook to Appeal German Order on WhatsApp Data
headline.main: Facebook to Appeal German Order on WhatsApp Data

docs.snippet: Facebook Inc on Friday apologized for an error in the way it measured a key metric of video viewership that significantly amplified users' viewing times on its platform.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Apologizes for Overstating Key Ad Metric
headline.main: Facebook Apologizes for Overstating Key Ad Metric

docs.snippet: The social network adds to Messenger with the introduction of “secret conversations” that are protected by encryption.

headline.main: Daily Report: Keep It Secret on Facebook Messenger

docs.snippet: The Indian cricket board said it had received interest from Facebook Inc and Twitter Inc for media rights to the popular Indian Premier League (IPL) Twenty20 cricket tournament.

headline.print_headline: Facebook, Twitter Weigh Bids for Media Rights to India Cricket League
headline.main: Facebook, Twitter Weigh Bids for Media Rights to India Cricket League

docs.snippet: Stocks that moved substantially or traded heavily Friday:

headline.print_headline: Yahoo and Facebook Slip; Endo and AAR Gain Ground
headline.main: Yahoo and Facebook Slip; Endo and AAR Gain Ground

docs.snippet: Pakistani police say they have arrested a 16-year-old Christian boy on blasphemy charges after he "liked" an "inappropriate" photograph on Facebook of the Kaaba in Mecca, one of the holiest sites in Islam.

headline.print_headline: Pakistani Christian Jailed for Blasphemy Over Facebook Like
headline.main: Pakistani Christian Jailed for Blasphemy Over Facebook Like

docs.snippet: After the death of Philando Castile and sniper fire in Dallas were streamed on Facebook, the company faces questions about how to handle graphic content.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Live Videos  Pose Tangle of Questions
headline.main: Live Footage of Shootings Forces Facebook to Confront New Role

docs.abstract: Facebook grapples with questions raised by its live-video application following real-time streaming of shooting of Philandro Castile by police in Minnesota and ambush of officers in Dallas; evolution of social media platform into news source is forcing company to realize it needs content guidelines.

docs.snippet: The app has long taken a back seat to the social media giant’s WhatsApp, but Facebook hopes the service will attract a global audience.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Is Pushing Messenger, a Rival to Its Own WhatsApp
headline.main: Facebook to Add ‘Secret Conversations’ to Messenger App

docs.abstract: Facebook is vigorously pushing its Messenger photo and text messaging service, rival to its popular WhatsApp, by adding new features like ability to encrypt messages; company is aiming for global audience.
